articles.title: How Argentina’s Favorite Song Became the World Cup’s Soundtrack
articles.description: The song, Muchachos, Ahora Nos Volvimos A Ilusionar, has been a constant refrain in Qatar.
articles.content: But it is also a familiar tune to most Argentine fans. Various Argentine club teams have their own bespoke versions of Muchachos, Esta Noche Me Emborracho, a 2003 hit for the rock band La Mosca Tsé tsé, led by the 62-year-old singer Guillermo Novelli... [1225 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-France awaits as back-to-back World Cup bid begins
articles.description: Soccer fans gathered on the Champs Elysees boulevard in Paris and packed bars and sports centres across France as Sunday's World Cup final against Argentina got underway. Supporters near the Arc de Triomphe braved near-freezing temperatures, breaking out into song as they urged "Les Bleus" to bring back the cup for a second straight tournament.
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentina, France face off for the World Cup title
articles.description: Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappe will look to bring the World Cup title home for Argentina or France on Sunday. Coverage begins on FOX at 9 a.m. ET.
articles.content:
Lionel Messi's quest for a title
Lionel Messi only has about 90 more minutes of play for the Argentina national team to secure his first World Cup title and solidify his spot as the greatest soccer player of all time.

articles.title: World Cup 2022 live
articles.description: Two teams remain in the 2022 Qatar World Cup. Sunday's final features Lionel Messi and Julian Alvarez leading Argentina against Olivier Giroud, Kylian Mbappe and France. Here are the best moments and biggest plays.
articles.content:
As we approach the end of an enthralling month's action, we take a look back at the highlights and lowlights of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. (2:10)
Of the 32 teams that came to Qatar for the 2022 World Cup, only two remain.

articles.title: FIFA World Cup: Argentina and France make key changes ahead of blockbuster decider
articles.description: A World Cup final means so much more than individuals, but at the core of this decider’s storylines is the GOAT and his potential replacement.

articles.title: Argentina faces defending champion France in men's World Cup final
articles.description: Can Lionel Messi win soccer's biggest prize to secure his place alongside Pele and Diego Maradona in the pantheon of the game's greatest ever players? Standing in his way is France, the defending champion, and Kylian Mbappe, the player best positioned to take over from Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo as soccer's marquee name.
articles.content:
It's now or never for Lionel Messi.
The Argentina superstar's once-in-a-generation career will be defined — for many — by whether he leads his country to the World Cup title.
Can he finally, at the age of 35, win soccer's biggest prize to secure his ... [1268 chars]
